node.title: Kraft will pay for your holiday desserts, cheesecake not included
node.description: The supply chain crisis may impact cheesecake availability for the holidays. So Kraft wants to pay for you to enjoy another dessert for the holidays.
node.content: ["For many families, cheesecakes are a staple of the holiday season. But this year's holiday season is coming amid a national shortage of cream cheese and other goods. So, Kraft, the company that makes Philadelphia cream cheese, is offering to pay for you to get another dessert that will \"pull you into holiday feelings.\"\u00a0", "Retailers have warned that the holiday season will see\u00a0empty shelves and higher prices.\u00a0", "The supply chain issue began early last year\u2014 at the start of the pandemic \u2014 as COVID-19 changed people's day-to-day lives, including how they eat, Farm Bureau senior economist Veronica Nigh\u00a0previously told CBS News.\u00a0", "In recent weeks in New York, bagel shops have said they are running out of cream cheese, according to a report from The New York Times. Many of those shops say they start their cream cheese mixes with Philadelphia cream cheese.\u00a0", "Kraft seems to not be taking any chances.\u00a0", "Their offer, a $20 digital reward, will be given to 18,000 people in the U.S. On a site dedicated to the promotion, Kraft said that eligible adults can claim a \"dessert reservation\" on Saturday and Sunday at noon ET each day. The reservations are on a first-come, first-serve basis, with 10,000 people able to claim the reward on Saturday, and another 8,000 able to claim it on Sunday.\u00a0", "Those who receive the reward will receive their $20 within two to four weeks of uploading their dessert purchase receipt to a unique link that Kraft will send out.\u00a0", "\"At Philadelphia, we believe these moments of delight that pull you into holiday feelings really matter. So, if cheesecake is on less holiday tables this year, we want to make sure that you still get the holiday feeling, even if it's through other desserts,\" Kraft's website says. \"If you can't spread Philly, spread the feeling.\"", "Li Cohen is a social media producer and trending reporter for CBS News, focusing on social justice issues."]
